GeneralInformation.History: Founded 1860. A private institution affiliated with the Evangelical Lutheran Church in America.
AdmissionRequirements: Graduation from high school or equivalent, and College Board SAT or ACT examination

GeneralInformation.History: Founded 1883 as Normal School. Acquired present status 1885 and title 1989.
AdmissionRequirements: Graduation from high school or equivalent, and College Board SAT or ACT examination

GeneralInformation.History: Founded 1881. Formerly known as Dakota State College. Acquired present status and title 1989.
Founded and charterd 1885 as postsecondary institution, acquired present title 1904.

GeneralInformation.History: Created 1941. The University has been providing accredited education for 80 years, and offers online programmes with flexible scheduling. Moved to 100% online classes 2019-2020.
GeneralInformation.AcademicYear: September to August, with monthly starts
AdmissionRequirements: Completed secondary school diploma, with overseas diplomas requiring evaluation by NACES or AICE; English-language proficiency (TOEFL, IELTS, TOIEC scores to be submitted)
Graduate degree is required for entrance to the PhD programme

GeneralInformation.History: Founded 1970 as Sinte Gleska College. Acquired present title and status1992.

GeneralInformation.History: Founded 1881 as Agricultural College of South Dakota, became State College of Agriculture and Mechanic Arts 1907, and acquired present title 1964.

GeneralInformation.History: Founded 1883 as Dakota Collegiate Institute, became Sioux Falls College 1960, and acquired present title 1995. A private institution affiliated with the Baptist Church.
AdmissionRequirements: Graduation from high school or equivalent, and College Board SAT or ACT examination
Graduation from high school or equivalent, and College Board SAT or ACT examination; International students need Financial Ability Form, ECE Report, TOEFL scores and bank statements or letter
